title: The root schema
description: The root schema comprises the entire JSON document.

examples.name: Software Architecture
examples.description: Refers to the fundamental structures of a software system and the discipline of creating such structures and systems. Each structure comprises software elements, relations among them, and properties of both elements and relations

areas.name: Sys Integration
areas.description: Knowledge and tools that allow an application to connect with other systems or devices, from web based services to Bluetooth connections.

areas.name: Architecture Types
areas.description: Architecture design patterns, navigation and ui components.

areas.name: Data Access / Persistency
areas.description: Best practices for design and implementation of data access and storage.

areas.name: Application Lifecycle
areas.description: Knowledge of the current ecosystem framework to support application states and life-cycle.

areas.name: NFRs
areas.description: Implementation tasks that don't constitute the actual product functionality such as analytics, performance and security.

examples.name: Software Engineer Practices
examples.description: Is there an "ideal software development project, and, if so, what are steps you should take to achieve this ideal state? There are strict guidelines and different software development best practices methodologies such as scrum or extreme programming, but I have come to the realization that its not always possible – or wise – to strictly follow these processes.

areas.name: (T/B/D)DD
areas.description: Test Driven Development, Behavior Driven Development, Domain Driven Design.

areas.name: Specialization
areas.description: Particular knowledge used in specific industries or a studio practice.

areas.name: Design Patterns
areas.description: Common software design patterns, creational, behavioral, structural...

areas.name: Algorithm & Structures
areas.description: Common algorithms used throughout software engineering such as sorting.
